applications.informationAspect:
Master Data : Parts , Suppliers , Price List , Currency , ISO , Company Data , Equipment , 
Transaction Data: Requisitions , Order , Receipts , Invoice , Payments , Bank Reconciliation , Vouchers, General Ledgers , Cash Book , Work Orders
applications.keyArchDecisions:
Master Data : Parts , Suppliers , Price List , Currency , ISO , Company Data , Equipment , 
Transaction Data: Requisitions , Order , Receipts , Invoice , Payments , Bank Reconciliation , Vouchers, General Ledgers , Cash Book , Work Orders
applications.skill: Distribution , Finance , Service Management , Technical – Dot Net , Java , Oracle , XML , UML
applications.keyBPSupported:
Finance (account payable, accounts receivable, Chart of Accounts, Invoicing)
In APMT, IFS includes Acounts Payable, Acounts Receivable, General Ledger, Fixed Asset, Bank Reconciliation, Cash Bank as a part of Finance module.

a. Distribution 
Inventory Management
Inbound Distribution
Purchase Requisition
Order
Receipts

b. Asset Management
Equipment management

c. Service Management
Work Order Processing
applications.description:
APM Terminals is using IFS as Global ERP product,  which provides both terminals and Inland Services ea way to maintain, standardize and improve their processes for Finance (account payable, accounts receivable, Chart of Accounts, Invoicing)

In APMT, IFS includes Acounts Payable, Acounts Receivable, General Ledger, Fixed Asset, Bank Reconciliation, Cash Bank as a part of Finance module. Besides that other key module involves; Along with that other key functional areas are Distribution, Asset Management & Service Management

interactions.remarks: Contains interface details about GCSS and GMS.
interactions.interfaceEvent:
For inbound -->In case of following GCSS events
1. Schedule_Shipment_Closed_On_Related_Shipment
2. Issue_Verify_Copy_of_TPDOC_InProgress
3. Issue_Amended_Verify_Copy_of_TPDOC_InProgress
4. Documentation party deleted
5. Documentation Print level changed
6. Seal Number changed
7. GDS submitted to Hermes for verification
8. TPDoc renumbered
9. Receive_Transport_Document_Instructions_Closed
10. Related_Shipment_Splitted
11. Cargo_Line_Sequence_Changed
12. Shipment_Merge_or_Split
13. TPDoc removed
14. Arrange Cargo Release BB CC Closed 
15. GCSS Archive TPDoc Event
16. Arrange Cargo Release Closed

For outbound -->
Whenever compliance status changes/ customs response received
interactions.domainState: update with same identifier
interactions.triggerType:
Inbound --> Event Triggered

Outbound --> Schedule Trigerred

interactions.interfaceDetails: Vessel/voyage numbers, expected and actualy arrival date and time
interactions.domainState: When Inbound GCSS Imports Haulage messages or WCRS amendments to the Import Haulage, are processed in CDS. f vessel information is missing in the Vessel table CDS will not accept the messages and will bypass the IPI. When Inbound GCSS Imports Haulage messages or WCRS amendments to the Import Haulage are processed in CDS, if IPI fails the VESSEL DATE RULE CDS will bypass the IPI. The VESSEL DATE RULE involves Actual and Estimated Arrival Times of the vessel retrieved from the CDS Vessel table

RKCM.CDS.WO.REPLY

interactions.payloadTemplateId: Whenever there are Link update/insert/delete in MEPC end
interactions.informationFlow:
RKCM saves the Link information from MEPC in RKCM IMS Database, which are referred by RKCM01 & RKCM02 Screens
1) Whenever MEPC inserts/updates/deletes a link data in their end, a request is placed on the queue RKCM.MEPC.LINKS.REPLICAT, which triggers the RKCMLRP job (Link Replication Program). This job will update the RKCM IMS database – which will be referred by RKCM01 screen.
2) Whenever MEPC inserts/updates/deletes a Corridor data in their end, a request is placed on the queue RKCM.MEPC.CORRIDORS.REPLICAT, which triggers the RKCMCRP job (Corridor Replication Program). This job will update the RKCM IMS database – which will be referred by RKCM02 screen
interactions.interfaceDetails: Link/ Corridor data from MEPC will be sent to RKCM
interactions.interfaceEvent:
RKCM:
1) Link information(referred by RKCM01)
Queue Name: RKCM.MEPC.LINKS.REPLICAT (when messages are placed in this queue RKCMLRP job executes)
Local Queue manager: IQM1 

2) Corridor information(referred by RKCM02)
Queue Name: RKCM.MEPC.CORRIDORS.REPLICAT (when messages are placed in this queue RKCMCRP job executes)
Local Queue manager: IQM1
interactions.domainState: Insert(N); Update (U) ; Delete(D) Operations for Links & Corridors

interactions.payloadTemplateId: Users who have update access to RKCM01 & RKCM02 can directly update through IMS screens
interactions.informationFlow: RKCM IMS Database will get updated.
interactions.interfaceDetails: Link/Corridor information will be referred in RKCM IMS Database
interactions.interfaceEvent:
Online IMS Transaction: MM01
Online IMS Region: IMS1
Program: RKCM01 & RKCM02
interactions.domainState: Insert(N); Update (U) ; Delete(D) Operations for Links & Corridors
